projectPurpose: To provide a blazing fast and lightweight server for serving map tiles from PostGIS, MBtiles, and PMtiles sources, along with tools for tile generation and MBtiles management.
mainFeatures: Blazing fast and lightweight tile serving
Supports PostGIS, MBtiles, and PMtiles data sources

alternatives.name: TileServer GL
mainFeatures: Serves vector and raster maps with GL styles
Server-side rendering with MapLibre GL Native
Supports MBTiles and tiles over HTTP

alternatives.name: Tegola
mainFeatures: Supports PostGIS and GeoPackage data providers
Slices geospatial data into vector tiles

alternatives.name: pg_tileserv
mainFeatures: Executes SQL to return MVT tiles

alternatives.name: GeoServer
mainFeatures: Supports vector tile output (GeoJSON, TopoJSON, MVT)

alternatives.name: mbtileserver
mainFeatures: Supports PNG, JPG, WebP, and PBF tilesets
Can serve from multiple MBTiles files

alternatives.name: MapTiler Server
mainFeatures: Offers raster and vector tile serving
WMTS and OGC Tiles API support

alternatives.name: ArcGIS Server
mainFeatures: Serves raster and vector map tiles

marketPositioning: Martin is positioned as a high-performance, lightweight, and versatile open-source tile server. Its key differentiators are its focus on speed and efficiency, support for a combination of popular geospatial tile formats (MBtiles, PMtiles) and dynamic PostGIS serving within a single tool, and inclusion of MBtiles tooling. It competes with more comprehensive open-source GIS servers by offering a simpler, faster alternative specifically for tile delivery and with commercial tile services by providing a free, self-hostable option with strong performance.
